title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
General Motors will halt production at several North American factories and extend shutdowns at others because of a chip shortage that has been worsening for U.S. auto giants.

---

P&G helped develop an advertising technique being tested in China to gather iPhone data for targeted ads, a step intended to give companies a way around Apple's new privacy tools.

---

Initial jobless claims, a proxy for layoffs, rose by a seasonally adjusted 16,000 last week to 744,000, the Labor Department said.

---

Florida sued U.S. health authorities to force the restart of cruise sailings, asking a court to set aside the CDC's conditional-sailing order.

---

SoftBank is investing $500 million in mortgage lender Better as the Japanese conglomerate seeks to ride a wave of swelling startup valuations.

---

The S&P 500 gained 0.4% to close at a record. The Dow and Nasdaq rose 0.2% and 1%, respectively.

---

GameStop said it is nominating Chewy co-founder Ryan Cohen to be chairman, as the videogame retailer continues its turnaround.

---

An SEC official warned companies going public through deals with SPACs against issuing enticing but misleading statements about their future growth.

---

Netflix reached a deal with Sony Pictures Entertainment for domestic streaming rights to the studio's theatrical movies.
